summary: A victim notification letter from the U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, informing a victim witness professional about the arraignment, bail hearing, and trial scheduling in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It provides details on accessing case documents and updates through the Victim Notification System.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in case 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), who entered a plea of not guilty to the Superseding Indictment and was ordered incarcerated pending trial.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, who scheduled the trial date for July 12, 2021, at the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse.

events.title: Arraignment, Initial Conference, and Bail Hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A court hearing was held where Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded not guilty to the Superseding Indictment. The court ruled she would be incarcerated pending trial and scheduled discovery, motion deadlines, and a trial date.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The court scheduled the trial to begin on this date before Judge Alison J. Nathan.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arraigned on July 14, 2019, pleaded not guilty, and was ordered incarcerated pending trial.
The trial was scheduled for July 12, 2021, before Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Southern District of New York.
This document is a victim notification letter, indicating that victims or potential victims were identified during the investigation.
The document provides instructions for accessing case documents through the DOJ's Victim Notification System website.
